document.docAuthor: Mantelatto, Fernando L., Miranda, Ivana, Vera-Silva, Ana L., Negri, Mariana, Buranelli, Raquel C., Terossi, Mariana, Magalhães, Tatiana, Costa, Rogério C., Zara, Fernando J. & Castilho, Antonio L.
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: IV. Infraorder Anomura: Superfamilies Chirostyloidea, Galatheoidea, Hippoidea and Paguroidea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: IV. Infraorder Anomura: Superfamilies Chirostyloidea, Galatheoidea, Hippoidea and Paguroidea

Remarks. Morphological variation in the length of antennal peduncles between populations of
Pagurus criniticornis
from the northern and southern hemisphere raised doubts about its true distribution ( Nucci & Melo 2007 ), and about its taxonomic status. Remarkable individual variations were reported by Forest & Saint Laurent (1968) . A preliminary molecular phylogeny revealed close relationship among South American species of the “
provenzanoi
” clade, including
P. criniticornis ( Olguín & Mantelatto 2013 )
. Sequences accession numbers (GenBank): CCDB779—16S ( DQ369947 ), CCDB 463—COI ( MF490059 ) (
Mantelatto et al. 2006
, 2018).
